prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(openxlsx)
library(edgeR)
library(apeglm)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(gplots)
library(RColorBrewer)

# Read count table
count_table <- read.xlsx("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", sheet = 1)
genes <- count_table[, 1] # Gene names
counts <- count_table[, -1] # Count data

# Read annotation data
annotation <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep = "\t")
group <- annotation$group # Group variable

# Perform statistical test using edgeR
dge <- DGEList(counts)
dge <- calcNormFactors(dge)
group_design <- model.matrix(~group)
dge <- estimateDisp(dge, group_design)
fit <- glmQLFit(dge, group_design)
qlf <- glmQLFTest(fit, contrast = c("group", "non-ischemic cardiomyopathy", "CASE"))

# Find genes specific for each group
sig_genes <- topTags(qlf)$table
specific_genes <- split(sig_genes$genes, sig_genes$logFC > 0)

# Filter count table for specific genes
filtered_counts <- counts[rownames(counts) %in% unlist(specific_genes), ]

# Perform PCA using filtered counts
pca <- prcomp(t(filtered_counts))

# Plot PCA with color-coded groups
sample_names <- colnames(counts)[-1]
pca_df <- data.frame(sample = sample_names, pca$x)
pca_df$group <- group
color_palette <- brewer.pal(nlevels(factor(group)), "Set1")
pca_plot <- ggplot(pca_df, aes(PC1, PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  scale_color_manual(values = color_palette) +
  theme_minimal()+
  geom_text_repel(aes(label=sample, color = NULL), size = 3) +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2")
print(pca_plot)
